dataModel.title: Prototype Veg Plots Database Component Description: Interpretation
dataModel.author: J. Harris

entity.entitySummary: This table was designed to allow all users, including the author and/or subsequent interpreters to use taxon names and authorities to describe a plant type.
entity.entityDescription: The development of this table was initiated at the working group meeting at NCEAS in September 2000. The desire to re-interpret the taxon names used by the plot author was realized and this table subsequently initiated.

attribute.attNotes: Primary key for the interpretation table.
attribute.attDefinition: Database assigned value for a unique interpretation of a taxon used in a plot observation.

attribute.attNotes: Foreign key into the taxonObservation table.
attribute.attDefinition: This key 'links' the interpretation to a particular taxon recognized in a plot.

attribute.attNotes: Foreign key into the party table.
attribute.attDefinition: This key links the party that made the interpretation, which could be the author.
This is the role of the party making the interpretation. Expected values may be: plot author, publication author, database manager.
Foreign key into the taxonRef (in the plantTaxa database) table to identify the publication wherein the circumscription was published.
Foreign key into the taxonName (in the plantTaxa database) table to identify the name of the taxon as used in the reference wherin the circumscription was published.
Foreign key into the taxonName (in the plantTaxa database) table to identify the name applied by the interpeter to the circumscription.
The date that the interpretation was made.
A simple set of categories for the interpretation including the original, current, simplified for comparative analysis (i.e., dumbed down to match a common level of resolution).

attribute.attNotes: Generally, the reason for the interpretation.
attribute.attDefinition: These are the notes that the interpreter would like to include with the interpretation.
